Description: Shoulder and body sherd (mended from four fragments) of Vroulian pottery closed vessel, probably an amphora; glazed streaky black; exterior: on shoulder, incised lotus with added red on petals and part of palmette; at turn to body, reserved band with two narrow brown bands; on body, part of palmette with red on alternating petals and part of lotus with red on leaves.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding shape and decoration, see Kinch 1914, 186, fig. 68. Vroulian amphorai are not commonly found, only a very few examples were found in Rhodes. nonetheless, Kinch's typology for Vroulian amphorai (Kinch 1914 185-7) consists of three groups and this sherd probably belongs to Group A. The pattern decoration and techinque suggests that this sherd is contemporary with the Vroulian cups with everted rims.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GN.01) (phase 3)
